loreTitle: Game Design & Depression: Actual Sunlight vs. Depression Quest
episodeTitle: Season 1, Episode 1: "How Actual Sunlight and Depression Quest design their depression"

synopsisQuestions.What is the primary game design concept: Joe and I talk about Depression and how the feeling of depression is expressed in two games: Actual Sunlight and Depression Quest.
synopsisQuestions.What specific games are analyzed, and wh: Specifically, we talk about the empathetic mechanics of Depression Quest and how it's different from a purely sympathetic take on the same mindset in Actual Sunlight.
synopsisQuestions.What is the central argument or key take: Narratives are often communicated in sympathetic ways in video games. It's easy to miss that empathetic stories can be shared via mechanics.

episodeLoreQuestions.Does this episode have a specific 'story: Not this one. This is the first time we see Joe in a video.

productionTidbitsQuestions.What was a notable challenge or interest: This was the first time I did a conversation like this, with me and my plush robot, Joe. My wife named Joe, saying it was a 'cup of Joe'. Joe is a real life version of the Games Over Coffee Logo. When I first made the logo, Taylor (friend of the show) said it looked like a robot. That made me wanna make it real. Also, the reason why it begins with the words Half Caff is because that's what the show was called at the time.
productionTidbitsQuestions.Were there any alternative ideas or conc: I made a concept episode to test out how this conversation would work. It's posted in my Patreon section of the discord. I played with the idea that I would annoy Joe because I wanted to talk about game design all the time.

loreTitle: Player Agency: What Remains of Edith Finch vs Gone Home
episodeTitle: Season 1, Episode 2: "Player Agency: What Remains of Edith Finch vs Gone Home"

synopsisQuestions.What is the primary game design concept: Player Agency and the feeling of player motivated tasks within a story
synopsisQuestions.What specific games are analyzed, and wh: I compare What Remains of Edith Finch to Gone Home and talk about the differences in player agency.
synopsisQuestions.What is the central argument or key take: I try to make the point that some types of player motivation can increase player agency when the player's actions are nuanced. This is another take on my "empathetic mechanics" design theory.

episodeLoreQuestions.Does this episode have a specific 'story: This is the first time Joe shows interest in creating a story of his own. He decides, at the end of the episode, to make a game called "chopping fish" because of the way that DeVaugh praised the fish cannery scene in WRODF.

productionTidbitsQuestions.What was a notable challenge or interest: I kept my graphics aesthetic of the glass backed videos (that I invented for the series).

loreTitle: Bubsy's game design is focused more on aesthetics than gameplay
episodeTitle: Season 1, Episode 3: "Bubsy's game design is focused more on aesthetics than gameplay"

synopsisQuestions.What is the primary game design concept: A deep look into the strange behavior of Bubsy's game design and its motivations.
synopsisQuestions.What specific games are analyzed, and wh: I compare Bubsy to Sonic, but from a design perspective, showing they have almost nothing in common and completely different design philosophies.
synopsisQuestions.What is the central argument or key take: Contrary to popular belief, Bubsy is nothing like Sonic

episodeLoreQuestions.Does this episode have a specific 'story: This is the first time we show a world that exists beyond myself and Joe. Joe talks directly to the audience at the end of the video for the first time. Joe tells me he needs samples of my voice
episodeLoreQuestions.If applicable, are there any specific ch: Joe is shown to have the ability to connect to the internet and watch media

easterEggsQuestions.Are there any subtle nods to previous ep: Reference to the first episode - I ask Joe if he'll watch Office Space
easterEggsQuestions.Are there any inside jokes or community: Joe makes another Patreon mention but I don't know what he's talking about

productionTidbitsQuestions.What was a notable challenge or interest: This was a very difficult episode to produce. Mostly because I had to play Bubsy to completion. And even with save states, it's really difficult. I also played Sonic 1 to completion to make sure I didn't miss anything.
productionTidbitsQuestions.Any interesting facts about the recordin: I made this episode for my wife because she talked about Bubsy being one of her favorite childhood games.

loreTitle: The Witness is designed to change the way you see the world.
episodeTitle: Season 1, Episode 4: "The Witness is designed to change the way you see the world."

synopsisQuestions.What is the primary game design concept: The ways that The Witness guides the player to think in a very specific way
synopsisQuestions.What specific games are analyzed, and wh: I go over the basic idea of communication with Shovel Knight first, before going into the detailed ways that The Witness guides the player, using both the beginning of the game and the turning point.
synopsisQuestions.What is the central argument or key take: Game design can change the way the player thinks

episodeLoreQuestions.If applicable, are there any specific ch: Joe begins to unveil his mysterious intentions through dialogue

productionTidbitsQuestions.What was a notable challenge or interest: When I made this episode, I was annoyed that my office mates on the other side of the wall were vacuuming because it didn't give me clean audio. I decided to go with it and make it a part of the script.
productionTidbitsQuestions.Were there any alternative ideas or conc: I originally wanted to make a whole episode on The Witness, analyzing every puzzle's introduction, which led to Joe's question at the end.

loreTitle: GRIS has a stunning atmosphere but the mechanics tell a different story
episodeTitle: Season 1, Episode 5: "GRIS has a stunning atmosphere but the mechanics tell a different story"

synopsisQuestions.What is the primary game design concept: The ideas of conventional communication in gameplay
synopsisQuestions.What specific games are analyzed, and wh: GRIS, with some Papers, Please, Before Your Eyes, and Undertale
synopsisQuestions.What is the central argument or key take: Game mechanics also qualify as art.

episodeLoreQuestions.If applicable, are there any specific ch: Joe replicated my voice for the first time

productionTidbitsQuestions.What was a notable challenge or interest: This episode really stood out to me after the fact. I didn't realize it at the time but I liked this episode so much because I was basically talking about game design philosophy. Something I wouldn't know for a couple more years.
productionTidbitsQuestions.Any interesting facts about the recordin: The drawing I had is one of my favorite pieces. It's the artist's (https://ukiyoeheroes.com) vision of what Starfox looks like, reinterpreted as a Japanese print.
